intro: Valerianella ozarkana f. bushii, commonly known as the Ozark mountain valerian, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Ozark Highlands of the United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is often protected in conservation efforts.
